info.title: Injective Core API
info.description: This API spec describes SRAv3, REST and internal gRPC API.

get.description: Get history of past fill events, filtered by trade pair name

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Account address to get related fill events

parameters.name: tradePair
parameters.description: Trade pair name

get.description: Request for history bars. Each property of the response object is treated as a table column.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Symbol name or ticker.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are daily (D or 1D, 2D ... ), weekly (1W, 2W ...), monthly (1M, 2M...) and an intra-day resolution â€“ minutes(1, 2 ...).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including from

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including to. It can be in the future. In this case, the rightmost required bar is the latest available bar.

parameters.name: countback
parameters.description: Number of bars (higher priority than from) starting with to. If countback is set, from should be ignored.

get.description: Gets market summary for the latest interval (hour, day, month)

parameters.name: tradePair
parameters.description: Trade pair name

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Specify the resolution

get.description: Get a list of all instruments.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: ID of a symbol group. It is only required if you use groups of symbols to restrict access to instrument's data.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Specify Ethereum chain ID

post.description: Submit a signed 0x transaction encoding either a 0x fill or cancellation. If the 0x transaction encodes a fill, the sender is requesting a Coordinator signature required to fill the order(s) on-chain. If the 0x transaction encodes an order(s) cancellation request, the sender is requesting the included order(s) to be soft-cancelled by the Coordinator.

Within the Coordinator model, the Coordinator server is the source-of-truth when it comes to determining whether an order has been soft-cancelled. This endpoint can be used to query whether a set of orders have been soft-cancelled. The response returns the subset of orders that have been soft-cancelled.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Specify Ethereum chain ID

get.description: Retrieves a relayer account by address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of the relayer account.

get.description: Retrieves an active 0x order with meta info that is associated with the hash.

parameters.name: orderHash
parameters.description: The hash of the desired 0x order.

get.description: Retrieves an archive 0x order with meta info that is associated with the hash.

parameters.name: orderHash
parameters.description: The hash of the desired 0x order.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Specify a version to filter online accounts with this logic version.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Specify a threshold in seconds to filter online accounts within a period of time.

get.description: Retrieves a trade pair by name or hash.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify name of the trade pair.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Most effective way is to specify hash of the trade pair.

parameters.name: makerAssetData
parameters.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring makerAsset.

parameters.name: takerAssetData
parameters.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring takerAsset.

post.description: Retrieves a list of 0x orders matching the filtering rules.
Submit a signed derivative order to the relayer.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: Retrieves a list of orders given query parameters.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify page to return. Page numbering should be 1-indexed, not 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Limit the amount of items returned per page.  If a query provides an unreasonable perPage value, the API will return a validation error.

parameters.name: takerAssetData
parameters.description: ABIv2 encoded data marketID

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: Retrieves a list of available asset pairs and the information required to trade them.

parameters.name: assetDataA
parameters.description: Asset data field of first asset in the pair.

parameters.name: assetDataB
parameters.description: Asset data field of second asset in the pair.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify page to return. Page numbering should be 1-indexed, not 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Limit the amount of items returned per page.  If a query provides an unreasonable perPage value, the API will return a validation error.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: Retrieves a list of all fee recipient addresses for a relayer.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

post.description: Submit a signed make order to the relayer.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: Retrieves a specific order by orderHash.

parameters.name: orderHash
parameters.description: Specifies order hash.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

post.description: Submit a partial order and receive information required to complete the order.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: Retrieves the orderbook for a given asset pair.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify page to return. Page numbering should be 1-indexed, not 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Limit the amount of items returned per page.  If a query provides an unreasonable perPage value, the API will return a validation error.

parameters.name: baseAssetData
parameters.description: Asset data (makerAssetData or takerAssetData) designated as the base currency in the currency pair calculation of price.

parameters.name: quoteAssetData
parameters.description: Asset data (makerAssetData or takerAssetData) designated as the quote currency in the currency pair calculation of price.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: Retrieves a list of orders given query parameters. For querying an entire orderbook snapshot, the orderbook endpoint is recommended.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify page to return. Page numbering should be 1-indexed, not 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Limit the amount of items returned per page.  If a query provides an unreasonable perPage value, the API will return a validation error.

parameters.name: makerAssetProxyId
parameters.description: Filters orders where the maker asset is of certain asset proxy id.

parameters.name: takerAssetProxyId
parameters.description: Filters orders where the taker asset is of certain asset proxy id.

parameters.name: makerAssetAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders where the contract address for the maker asset matches the value specified.

parameters.name: takerAssetAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders where the contract address for the taker asset matches the value specified.

parameters.name: exchangeAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders created for this exchange address

parameters.name: senderAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified senderAddress

parameters.name: makerAssetData
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified makerAssetData

parameters.name: takerAssetData
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified takerAssetData

parameters.name: traderAssetData
parameters.description: Filters orders where either makerAssetData or takerAssetData has the value specified

parameters.name: makerAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified makerAddress

parameters.name: takerAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified takerAddress

parameters.name: makerFeeAssetData
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified makerFeeAssetData

parameters.name: takerFeeAssetData
parameters.description: Filters orders with the specified takerFeeAssetData

parameters.name: traderAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders where either makerAddress or takerAddress has the value specified

parameters.name: feeRecipientAddress
parameters.description: Filters orders where feeRecipientAddress is feeRecipient address

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

get.description: The SRA Websocket API is meant to supplement the REST API by providing updates without resorting to polling.

429.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded

assetData.description: ABIv2 encoded assetData representing that token.

maxAmount.description: The maximum trade amount the relayer will accept.

minAmount.description: The minimum trade amount the relayer will accept.

precision.description: The desired price precision a relayer would like to support within their orderbook.

bar-fillgaps.description: Is used to create the zero-volume bars in the absence of any trades

bar-source.description: The principle of building bars. The default value is trade.

bar-transform.description: The principle of bar alignment. The default value is none.

items.example: Quia est sunt ea aperiam officia sunt.

base-currency.description: For currency pairs only. This field contains the first currency of the pair. For example, base currency for EURUSD ticker is EUR. Fiat currency must meet the ISO 4217 standard.

currency.description: Symbol currency, also named as counter currency. If a symbol is a currency pair, then the currency field has to contain the second currency of this pair. For example, USD is a currency for EURUSD ticker. Fiat currency must meet the ISO 4217 standard. The default value is null.

items.example: Quae quasi corporis quia molestias blanditiis.

description.description: Description of a symbol. Will be displayed in the chart legend for this symbol.

items.example: Eius consequuntur et alias nesciunt sapiente perferendis.

exchange-listed.description: Short name of exchange where this symbol is listed.

items.example: Optio voluptates veniam qui quo quia.

exchange-traded.description: Short name of exchange where this symbol is traded.

expiration.description: Expiration of the futures in the following format: YYYYMMDD. Required for futures type symbols only.

fractional.description: Boolean showing whether this symbol wants to have complex price formatting (see minmov2) or not. The default value is false.

has-daily.description: The boolean value showing whether data feed has its own daily resolution bars or not.

has-intraday.description: Boolean value showing whether the symbol includes intraday (minutes) historical data.

has-no-volume.description: Boolean showing whether the symbol includes volume data or not. The default value is false.

has-weekly-and-monthly.description: The boolean value showing whether data feed has its own weekly and monthly resolution bars or not.

intraday-multipliers.description: This is an array containing intraday resolutions (in minutes) that the data feed may provide
example: Aut saepe quis quia nobis nostrum exercitationem.

is-cfd.description: Boolean value showing whether the symbol is CFD. The base instrument type is set using the type field.

minmov2.description: This is a number for complex price formatting cases.

pointvalue.description: The currency value of a single whole unit price change in the instrument's currency. If the value is not provided it is assumed to be 1.

pricescale.description: Indicates how many decimal points the price has. For example, if the price has 2 decimal points (ex., 300.01), then pricescale is 100. If it has 3 decimals, then pricescale is 1000 etc. If the price doesn't have decimals, set pricescale to 1

items.example: Atque voluptatum natus quibusdam unde magni sit.

root.description: Root of the features. It's required for futures symbol types only. Provide a null value for other symbol types. The default value is null.
example: Eum suscipit voluptas minima et voluptatem.

root-description.description: Short description of the futures root that will be displayed in the symbol search. It's required for futures only. Provide a null value for other symbol types. The default value is null.
example: Qui ipsum non dolorem libero quisquam voluptatem.

session-regular.description: Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies: the session string should be 24x7

symbol.description: This is the name of the symbol - a string that the users will see. It should contain uppercase letters, numbers, a dot or an underscore. Also, it will be used for data requests if you are not using tickers.

ticker.description: This is a unique identifier for this particular symbol in your symbology. If you specify this property then its value will be used for all data requests for this symbol.

items.example: Mollitia fugiat rem quia aut quisquam perferendis.

timezone.description: Timezone of the exchange for this symbol. We expect to get the name of the time zone in olsondb format.

intraday-multipliers: Delectus nisi consectetur dolores rerum non provident.
root-description: Consequatur numquam autem unde fugit explicabo.
ticker: Exercitationem ut quo non voluptas iure.

cancellationSignatures.description: An approval signature of the cancellation 0x transaction submitted to the Coordinator (with the expiration hard-coded to 0 -- although these never expire). These signatures can be used to prove that a soft-cancel was granted for these order(s).

expirationTimeSeconds.description: when the signatures will expire and no longer be valid

outstandingFillSignatures.description: Information about the outstanding signatures to fill the order(s) that have been soft-cancelled.

signatures.description: the Coordinator signatures required to submit the 0x transaction

DerivativeMarketResponseBody.title: DerivativeMarketResponseBody

baseCurrency.description: Address of the base currency for the derivative contract

enabled.description: If false, then the pair is suspended and trades cannot be made.

nonce.description: Random number to faciltate uniqueness of the derivative market ID

oracle.description: Address of the oracle for the derivative contract

DerivativeMarketResponseBody.description: An object describing a derivative market in the Injective Futures Protocol.

DerivativeOrderResponseBody.title: DerivativeOrderResponseBody

expirationTimeSeconds.description: Timestamp in seconds at which order expires.

makerAssetAmount.description: The price of 1 contract denominated in base currency.

makerAssetData.description: The account ID of the account entering into the position. Must be an account owned by makerAddress

makerFee.description: The direction of the contract. 1 for LONG, 2 for SHORT.

salt.description: Arbitrary number to facilitate uniqueness of the order's hash.

takerAssetAmount.description: The quantity of contracts the maker seeks to obtain.

takerAssetData.description: The marketID of the market for the position

DerivativeOrderResponseBody.description: A valid signed derivative order based on the schema.

expirationTimeSeconds.description: Timestamp in seconds at which order expires.

makerAssetAmount.description: The price of 1 contract denominated in base currency.

makerAssetData.description: The account ID of the account entering into the position. Must be an account owned by makerAddress

makerFee.description: The direction of the contract. 1 for LONG, 2 for SHORT.

salt.description: Arbitrary number to facilitate uniqueness of the order's hash.

takerAssetAmount.description: The quantity of contracts the maker seeks to obtain.

takerAssetData.description: The marketID of the market for the position

rLimitReset.description: The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds.

validationErrors.description: A list of explained validation errors.

chainId.description: Ethereum Chain ID of the transaction

verifyingContract.description: Address of the Injective Coordinator Contract.

ts.description: UNIX timestamp of the fill event

txHash.description: Transaction hash related to this fill

approvalSignatures.description: Array of signatures that correspond to the required signatures to execute each order in the transaction

expirationTimeSeconds.description: Timestamp in seconds at which approval expires

takerAssetFillAmount.description: Desired amount of takerAsset to sell

OrderResponseBody.title: OrderResponseBody

expirationTimeSeconds.description: Timestamp in seconds at which order expires.

feeRecipientAddress.description: Address that will receive fees when order is filled.

makerAssetAmount.description: Amount of makerAsset being offered by maker. Must be greater than 0.

makerAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring makerAsset.

makerFee.description: Amount of ZRX paid to feeRecipient by maker when order is filled. If set to 0, no transfer of ZRX from maker to feeRecipient will be attempted.

makerFeeAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring makerFee.

salt.description: Arbitrary number to facilitate uniqueness of the order's hash.

senderAddress.description: Address that is allowed to call Exchange contract methods that affect this order. If set to 0, any address is allowed to call these methods.

takerAddress.description: Address that is allowed to fill the order. If set to 0, any address is allowed to fill the order.

takerAssetAmount.description: Amount of takerAsset being bid on by maker. Must be greater than 0.

takerAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring takerAsset.

takerFee.description: Amount of ZRX paid to feeRecipient by taker when order is filled. If set to 0, no transfer of ZRX from taker to feeRecipient will be attempted.

takerFeeAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring takerFee.

OrderResponseBody.description: A valid signed 0x order based on the schema.

OrdersStreamingSubscribePayloadSchemaReq.title: OrdersStreamingSubscribePayloadSchemaRequestBody

chainId.description: The Ethereum chain id to which you'd like to subscribe.

makerAssetData.description: subscribes to new orders with the specified ABIv2 encoded makerAssetData

takerAssetData.description: subscribes to new orders with the specified ABIv2 encoded takerAssetData

OrdersStreamingSubscribePayloadSchemaReq.description: Trading pair assets for order streaming

RelayerAPIOrderConfigRateLimitResponseBo.description: Too many requests - Rate limit exceeded (default view)

expirationTimeSeconds.description: Timestamp in seconds at which order expires.

makerAssetAmount.description: Amount of makerAsset being offered by maker. Must be greater than 0.

makerAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring makerAsset.

takerAddress.description: Address that is allowed to fill the order. If set to 0, any address is allowed to fill the order.

takerAssetAmount.description: Amount of takerAsset being bid on by maker. Must be greater than 0.

takerAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring takerAsset.

feeRecipientAddress.description: Address that will receive fees when order is filled.

makerFee.description: Amount of ZRX paid to feeRecipient by maker when order is filled. If set to 0, no transfer of ZRX from maker to feeRecipient will be attempted.

makerFeeAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring makerFee.

rLimitLimit.description: The maximum number of requests you're permitted to make per hour.

rLimitRemaining.description: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

rLimitReset.description: The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds.

senderAddress.description: Address that is allowed to call Exchange contract methods that affect this order. If set to 0, any address is allowed to call these methods.

takerFee.description: Amount of ZRX paid to feeRecipient by taker when order is filled. If set to 0, no transfer of ZRX from taker to feeRecipient will be attempted.

takerFeeAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring takerFee.

RelayerAccountResponseBody.title: RelayerAccountResponseBody

address.description: Cosmos address of the relayer account.

isOnline.description: A flag of liveness status of the account. Must be considered with lastSeen timestamp.

lastSeen.description: Timestamp in UNIX seconds of the last time seen.

publicKey.description: Public key of the relayer account, as hex string.

stakerAddress.description: Ethereum address associated with this relayer account.

RelayerAccountResponseBody.description: A relayer account that enhances Cosmos Account with liveness info.

SRAPaginatedOrderRecordsResponseBody.title: SRAPaginatedOrderRecordsResponseBody
SRAPaginatedOrderRecordsResponseBody.description: A paginated array of signed orders.

data.description: The calldata that is to be executed. This must call an Exchange contract method.

expirationTimeSeconds.description: Timestamp in seconds at which transaction expires.

gasPrice.description: gasPrice that transaction is required to be executed with.

salt.description: Arbitrary number to facilitate uniqueness of the transactions's hash.

TradePairResponseBody.title: TradePairResponseBody

enabled.description: If false, then the pair is suspended and trades cannot be made.

hash.description: Hash of both asset data, to identify the trading pair in store.

makerAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring makerAsset.

name.description: A name of the pair in format AAA/BBB, where AAA - maker's asset, BBB - taker's asset.

takerAssetData.description: ABIv2 encoded data that can be decoded by a specified proxy contract when transferring takerAsset.

TradePairResponseBody.description: An object describing trade pair of two assets.
